definitions.example: This is a new scratch on my car!   The band just released a new album.
We turned up some new evidence from the old files.

definitions.definition: Current or later, as opposed to former.
definitions.example: My new car is much better than my previous one, even though it is older.   We had been in our new house for five years by then.

definitions.definition: Used to distinguish something established more recently, named after something or some place previously existing.
definitions.example: New Bond Street is an extension of Bond Street.

definitions.definition: In original condition; pristine; not previously worn or used.
definitions.example: Are you going to buy a new car or a second-hand one?
That shirt is dirty. Go and put on a new one.   I feel like a new person after a good night's sleep.   After the accident, I saw the world with new eyes.
My sister has a new baby, and our mother is excited to finally have a grandchild.

definitions.definition: Of recent origin; having taken place recently.
definitions.example: I can't see you for a while; the pain is still too new.   Did you see the new King Lear at the theatre?

definitions.definition: Strange, unfamiliar or not previously known.
definitions.example: The idea was new to me.   I need to meet new people.
Have you met the new guy in town?   He is the new kid at school.

definitions.definition: Inexperienced or unaccustomed at some task.
definitions.example: Don't worry that you're new at this job; you'll get better with time.   I'm new at this business.

definitions.definition: (of a period of time) Next; about to begin or recently begun.
definitions.example: We expect to grow at 10% annually in the new decade.
